    • Method Detail

      • getLastOccurence

        public long getLastOccurence(android.text.format.Time dtstart,
                             RecurrenceSet recur)
                      throws DateException
        Returns the time (millis since epoch) of the last occurrence, or -1 if the event repeats forever. If there are no occurrences (because the exrule or exdates cancel all the occurrences) and the event does not repeat forever, then 0 is returned. This computes a conservative estimate of the last occurrence. That is, the time of the actual last occurrence might be earlier than the time returned by this method.
        Parameters:
        dtstart - the time of the first occurrence
        recur - the recurrence
        Returns:
        an estimate of the time (in UTC milliseconds) of the last occurrence, which may be greater than the actual last occurrence
        Throws:
        DateException

      • getLastOccurence

        public long getLastOccurence(android.text.format.Time dtstart,
                             android.text.format.Time maxtime,
                             RecurrenceSet recur)
                      throws DateException
        Returns the time (millis since epoch) of the last occurrence, or -1 if the event repeats forever. If there are no occurrences (because the exrule or exdates cancel all the occurrences) and the event does not repeat forever, then 0 is returned. This computes a conservative estimate of the last occurrence. That is, the time of the actual last occurrence might be earlier than the time returned by this method.
        Parameters:
        dtstart - the time of the first occurrence
        maxtime - the max possible time of the last occurrence. null means no limit
        recur - the recurrence
        Returns:
        an estimate of the time (in UTC milliseconds) of the last occurrence, which may be greater than the actual last occurrence
        Throws:
        DateException

      • expand

        public long[] expand(android.text.format.Time dtstart,
                     RecurrenceSet recur,
                     long rangeStartMillis,
                     long rangeEndMillis)
              throws DateException
        Expands the recurrence within the given range using the given dtstart value. Returns an array of longs where each element is a date in UTC milliseconds. The return value is never null. If there are no dates then an array of length zero is returned.
        Parameters:
        dtstart - a Time object representing the first occurrence
        recur - the recurrence rules, including RRULE, RDATES, EXRULE, and EXDATES
        rangeStartMillis - the beginning of the range to expand, in UTC milliseconds
        rangeEndMillis - the non-inclusive end of the range to expand, in UTC milliseconds; use -1 for the entire range.
        Returns:
        an array of dates, each date is in UTC milliseconds
        Throws:
        DateException
        android.util.TimeFormatException - if recur cannot be parsed

      • expand

        public void expand(android.text.format.Time dtstart,
                   EventRecurrence r,
                   long rangeStartDateValue,
                   long rangeEndDateValue,
                   boolean add,
                   java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Long> out)
            throws DateException
        Run the recurrence algorithm. Processes events defined in the local timezone of the event. Return a list of iCalendar DATETIME strings containing the start date/times of the occurrences; the output times are defined in the local timezone of the event. If you want all of the events, pass Long.MAX_VALUE for rangeEndDateValue. If you pass Long.MAX_VALUE for rangeEnd, and the event doesn't have a COUNT or UNTIL field, you'll get a DateException.
        Parameters:
        dtstart - the dtstart date as defined in RFC2445. This Time should be in the timezone of the event.
        r - the parsed recurrence, as defiend in RFC2445
        rangeStartDateValue - the first date-time you care about, inclusive
        rangeEndDateValue - the last date-time you care about, not inclusive (so if you care about everything up through and including Dec 22 1995, set last to Dec 23, 1995 00:00:00
        add - Whether or not we should add to out, or remove from out.
        out - the TreeSet you'd like to fill with the events
        Throws:
        DateException
        android.util.TimeFormatException - if r cannot be parsed.
